plugins.name: 暗色组件助手 Dark Mode Assistant for Components
plugins.description:
介绍

“暗色组件助手”插件旨在简化在 Figma 组件中管理暗黑模式的过程。通过几次点击，你可以快速启用任何选中组件或实例的暗黑模式，同时如果可用，插件会应用组件库中的暗色 token 设置。


功能说明

  1. 自动检测并启用选中组件和实例的暗黑模式。
  2. 递归检查并更新嵌套在组和框架中的所有组件的暗黑模式。
  3. 允许你将组件库中的“暗色” token 应用于外观模块。
  4. 与具有“componentProperties”和“appearance”模块的组件兼容。


使用方法

  1. 选中你希望应用暗黑模式的组件、组或框架。
  2. 点击插件按钮，插件会自动为所有选中的元素及其子元素启用暗黑模式。
  3. 插件会自动应用暗黑模式设置，并在可用的情况下将其链接到组件库中的“暗色”token。


注意事项

  1. 插件最佳工作效果是在具有属性定义的组件库中使用。
  2. 如果未找到“appearance”模块，插件仍然会启用暗黑模式，但不会应用 token。
  3. 确保你的组件已正确链接到包含暗黑模式 token 的组件库，以获得完整功能。


Introduction

The "Dark Mode Assistant for Components" plugin is designed to streamline the process of managing dark mode properties in Figma components. With just a few clicks, you can quickly enable dark mode for any selected component or instance, while also applying the appropriate token settings for dark mode if available.


Function Description

  1. Automatically detects and enables dark mode for selected components and instances.
  2. Recursively checks and updates dark mode for all nested components within groups and frames.
  3. Allows you to apply the "dark" token from your component library's appearance module.
  4. Works seamlessly with components that have "componentProperties" and "appearance" modules.


How to Use

  1. Select the components, groups, or frames that you want to apply dark mode to.
  2. Click the plugin button to enable dark mode for all selected elements and their children.
  3. The plugin will automatically apply the dark mode setting and, if available, link it to the "dark" token in your component library.


Precautions

  1. The plugin works best with components that have properties defined in the component library.
  2. If no "appearance" module is found, the plugin will still enable dark mode but will not apply the token.
  3. Ensure that your components are correctly linked to a component library with dark mode tokens for full functionality.

accepted.name: KingweiCheung
accepted.description: If you have any questions or suggestions, feel free to contact me at kingweichueng@qq.com.

plugins.tagline: Dark Mode Assistant for Components: Easily Toggle Dark Mode

plugins.name: Pixel Magic
plugins.description:
Transform your images into eye-catching pixel art with Pixel, the ultimate Figma plugin for pixel enthusiasts! Whether you're crafting retro aesthetics or exploring unique design styles, Pixie offers endless possibilities for creativity.


Why Use Pixel Pixie?

  1. Custom Backgrounds: Set your own background color to complement your design perfectly.
  2. Adjustable Precision: Control size for the ideal level of detail in your artwork.
  3. Pixel Shapes: Choose from various pixel shapes (squares, circles, and semi-circle) to customize your pixel art style.
  4. Export Type: Choose to export the pixelated effect as either an image or a group of nodes.


Designed for designers, artists, and creative minds, Pixie lets you reimagine your visuals in stunning pixelated forms. Discover how this versatile plugin can bring a bold new dimension to your designs.


Important Note:

  1. For node based export, the time to export depends based on number of nodes.
  2. It is better to not have huge number of nodes for better performance


Feedback & Support:

I'd love to see what you've created using this plugin! Feel free to tag me or say hi on X/Twitter (@HarshithAshvi). Your feedback and bug reports are always welcome 🙏


Contact:

Email: astroashvi@gmail.com

X/Twitter: https://x.com/HarshithAshvi

plugins.name: Responsive variables
plugins.description:
The plugin is designed to streamline the management of typography and sizing variables in responsive design projects. With this plugin, you can efficiently create and manage typography and sizing variables using standardized naming conventions and automate the creation of styles with linked variables.


Demo file https://www.figma.com/community/file/1419690653122064051/responsive-variables-demo


Key Features:


  1. Automatic Variable Creation: Generates typography or sizing variables based on a predefined naming convention.
  2. Linked Styles: Automatically creates text styles with linked variables, ensuring consistency and ease of updates.
  3. Parameter Multipliers: Manages parameters like line-height and letter-spacing using multipliers, allowing the plugin to calculate pixel dimensions.
  4. Style Guide Generation: Automatically create a style guide that's synced with all typography and spacing styles, giving you a quick overview of the design elements. This functionality will generate a new page called "Responsive variables".
  5. Used styles report (beta): This functionality allows users to generate a detailed report listing all the occurrences of different sizes used within a document, providing a comprehensive overview for analysis or optimization purposes


How it works:


  1. When the plugin starts, automatically load all local variables.
  2. The plugin automatically creates a new "Variables" collection where all the variables are stored.
  3. Every time you create a new variable, a text style is automatically created, and all the individual variables are bound to the corresponding property.
  4. Upon plugin load, the plugin generates a fileRefId variable containing a hash. This hash is used as a reference to store ordering data in the plugin’s local storage, ensuring data is kept separate for each file. If you encounter any issues, click the menu icon in the top-right corner of the plugin window and select “Reset Storage Data.”
plugins.tagline: Advanced Management of Typography Variables and Sizing for Responsive Design.

plugins.name: Polaroids
plugins.description:
Polaroids – Bring a Touch of Nostalgia to Your Designs

Transform any frame into a beautifully styled Polaroid image—in seconds.


Polaroid Maker is your go-to tool for adding a warm, analog vibe to digital designs. Whether you’re building a moodboard, designing a presentation, or crafting a portfolio, this plugin helps you wrap your visuals in the charm of vintage photography.


Features:

Adjustable Padding – Control the spacing for that perfect Polaroid balance.


Customizable Corner Radius – Keep it sharp or go rounded for a softer feel.


Handwritten-style Captions – Add personality with a built-in handwriting font.


Stacking Options – Single, double, or multiple cards for layered vibes.


Shadow Effects – Add subtle or dramatic depth with three shadow styles.


Polaroid Maker was built to make visual storytelling more tactile, expressive, and fun—without needing any design hacks or frame juggling.
plugins.tagline: Turn any frame into a clean, customizable Polaroid.

plugins.name: Chartific - Create charts with your own data
plugins.description:
Chartific: Create Charts with Your Own Data

Upload CSV or JSON file then create chart with your real data, no more dummy charts!


🚀 Why Chartific?

Say goodbye to placeholder charts and hello to data-driven design. Chartific transforms your raw data into beautiful, customizable visualizations directly in Figma:

  1. Instant Data Import: Drag and drop CSV or JSON files
  2. Real Data Visualization: Create charts with your actual data
  3. Seamless Figma Integration: Native plugin that works right in your design environment
  4. Flexible Customization: Choose your chart type, color, and data fields


🎨 Features

Multiple File Formats: Import CSV and JSON files


Chart Types:

  1. Bar Charts
  2. Line Charts
  3. (More chart types coming soon!)


Color Customization:

  1. Pick any color
  2. Use existing Figma color styles
  3. Responsive Design: Charts that scale perfectly with your Figma frames


📝 How to Use

  1. Open Chartific in Figma
  2. Drag and drop your CSV or JSON file
  3. Select label and value columns
  4. Choose chart type and color
  5. Click "Create in Figma"


🔜 Coming Soon

  1. Pie Charts
  2. Area Charts
  3. Advanced styling options
  4. More data visualization features!


🆘 Support & Feedback

  1. Encountered a bug? Report an Issue
  2. Questions or suggestions? Contact Us


Price: One-time $5 investment to supercharge your design workflow.

plugins.name: Figaro Design System Token
plugins.description:
Figma Plugin for Exporting Variables


This Figma plugin simplifies the export of design variables (such as colors, typography, and dimensions) into a structured JSON format. It's ideal for design and development teams aiming to maintain consistency between their Figma design system and codebase.


With this plugin, you can export local variables organized into collections, including details about modes, aliases, and default values, making it easy to integrate them into development workflows like creating design tokens or style systems in CSS or JavaScript.


Features:


Export color, typography, spacing, and more from Figma to JSON.

Support for variable collections and modes (e.g., dark/light mode).

Alias management for consistent use of styles across projects.

Easy integration with development tools to use exported variables in web or mobile projects.

This plugin helps you maintain a robust and scalable design system, seamlessly syncing design variables between Figma and your code.
plugins.tagline: Export Collection Variables

plugins.name: Onyx ◆ Design System to Code
plugins.description:
Onyx ◆ Design System to Code


◆ Overview


Onyx is designed to simplify the workflow between design and development by automating the conversion of your Figma Design System into ready-to-use Vue components. Its ability to handle multiple selected component variants and integrate design tokens provided via the Tokens Studio for Figma plugin makes it a powerful tool for modern web development.


Onyx is a Figma plugin designed to efficiently translate Figma Design Systems into Vue components, utilizing UnoCSS utility classes. This tool targets developers and designers looking to streamline the conversion of their design systems into functional, reactive UI components directly usable in Vue projects.


Project is open source:

https://github.com/onyx-gen/onyx



◆ What It Does


  • Figma Components to Vue Components: Onyx allows users to select components within Figma and generate corresponding Vue components. Design properties are translated to UnoCSS utility classes.


  • Support for Design Tokens: The plugin integrates with Tokens Studio, another Figma plugin, to convert design tokens into CSS variables. These variables are then passed to the UnoCSS utility classes (e.g., background color design token named primary.bg.hover generates the bg-$primary.bg.hover UnoCSS utility class)


  • Multi-Variant Component Support: Users can select multiple variants of a component (such as default, hover, and focused) and Onyx will generate a single Vue component. Onyx automatically applies the correct UnoCSS variants (e.g., bg-red-600 hover:bg-red-700 focus:bg-red-800)


  • Live Preview: Onyx provides a real-time preview of the generated Vue components within Figma via an iframe. This feature ensures that components are visually and functionally in sync with the Figma design.



◆ How to Use It


  1. Select Components: Start by selecting one or multiple components within your Figma design system.
  2. Open the Onyx Figma plugin: Open the Onyx Figma plugin in Figma's plugin panel.
  3. Generate Code: Onyx automatically generates Vue components for the selected Figma components.
  4. Implement in Project: Copy the generated Vue component into your Vue project.



◆ Limitations


  • Work in Progress: As the plugin is still under development, some design properties may not convert perfectly into UnoCSS utility classes. At the moment not all design tokens types can be applied.


  • Design Compatibility: There may be limitations in how certain Figma design properties translate to UnoCSS utility classes, potentially requiring manual adjustments.
plugins.tagline: Components & Design Tokens → Vue & UnoCSS

plugins.name: Keywords Generator
plugins.description:
Say goodbye to the daunting task of manually creating keywords for each component. With the AI-powered Keywords Generator plugin, you can instantly generate keywords for all your components.


How it works

Under the hood, the plugin generates a list of keywords that are synonym and closely related to the component title.


How to use

  1. Enter a valid OpenAI API key and click on "Validate Key". If successful, you'll be taken to the logged area.
  2. Select all components you wish to generate keywords for the description field (make sure you select the parent components)
  3. Select the keywords amounts and language
  4. Click on ”Generate Keywords” and wait until you see a success alert displayed


Note

  1. Please bear in mind that this plugin leverages an AI large language model, which may generate unexpected results or hallucinations. Leave a comment if you encounter unexpected outcomes or spot bugs
  2. You'll need an OpenAI API key with credit balance in order to use this plugin. Probably you won't ever use more than $0.10 in credit
  3. The time taken to generate the keywords will vary significantly depending on the amount of components selected


Ideas & Suggestions

This is a very first version and there's a lot to improve. I’d love to hear ideas and feature suggestions to continuously improve this plugin.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate AI-powered keywords for all your Figma components.

plugins.name: Figma 3D Animator Studio
plugins.description:
3D Animation Plugin for Figma

From Static to Cinematic Animate 3D Scenes Without Leaving Figma


Bring your designs to life with dynamic 3D animations, directly inside Figma. Whether you're crafting UI concepts, motion prototypes, or storytelling visuals, this plugin lets you seamlessly blend 3D power into your 2D workflow no external tools needed.


Key Features (v1):

Gizmo Controls: Move, rotate, and scale 3D models with intuitive handles


Full Scene Navigation: Orbit, pan, and zoom through a 3D workspace


Multiple Light Sources: Set up ambient, directional, point, spot, or hemisphere lighting


Custom HDRI Lighting: Add realistic environmental lighting using HDRI maps


Outliner Panel: Manage objects, hierarchy, and camera view easily


Transform Keyframes: Animate position, rotation, and scale with smooth transitions


Timeline & Animation Preview: Control frame rate, duration, and scrub through animations


Export Options: Render to MP4, GIF, WebM, or PNG sequences with frame-by-frame control


Built using Three.js, powered by AI tools, and designed to stay right at home in the Figma design environment this plugin is made for designers who want to push boundaries.


Take your prototypes from flat to phenomenal.
plugins.tagline: make your prototypes from flat to phenomenal.

plugins.name: Airtable Connect
plugins.description:
The plugin allows data from Airtable to be mapped to the layers of Figma components. This functionality is especially useful for designers looking to streamline their workflow and maximize efficiency. With this plugin, it is possible to generate multiple design variations in a matter of seconds, eliminating the need for manual adjustments one by one.


By integrating Airtable with Figma, designers can import structured data directly into their design files. For example, if you have a table in Airtable with different content versions for a marketing campaign, you can assign this data to text and image elements in your Figma components. This not only saves time but also reduces the risk of errors when copying and pasting information.


Furthermore, the plugin is highly versatile and can be used in a variety of projects, from creating user interface prototypes to generating personalized graphic material. Its intuitive use does not require advanced knowledge, making it accessible to both beginner and experienced designers.


In summary, this plugin transforms the way we work with data and design, providing an efficient and effective solution for creating dynamic and adaptable designs.


https://airtable-connect.livingcrowdland.com/
plugins.tagline: The plugin maps Airtable data to Figma layers, enabling quick creation of multiple design variations

plugins.name: Sunsetter
plugins.description:
Sunsetter is useful for deprecating components before publishing the next version of your design system.


  1. Supports bulk deprecation component sets and components, whether it is made of frames or auto layouts.
  2. Also supports adding your own prefix for the deprecation. If left blank, it uses the default.
  3. Deprecations can also be reversed in bulk. If a custom prefix is used, simply use the prefix and reverse.
  4. Red overlay can be turned off from more options
  5. Add notes with collects writes down deprecation notes in a separate frame
  6. Add _ to all deprecated components without changing any prefixes, just enable in more options


For feedback, please reach out to me on @amohgs

accepted.name: Amogh Srivastava
accepted.description: I love creating things that makes making other things faster

plugins.tagline: Deprecate components in a click

plugins.name: Automator: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.
plugins.description:
Want to create hundreds of creatives instantly? Well now you can!


Introducing Automator, a plugin built to make executing multiple creatives quick and easy.


How does it work?

Automator takes your existing creatives within Figma and applies data to that creative from a spreadsheet. You can simply drag your spreadsheet of data into Automator and it will convert that data into creatives. The only thing you need to do is make sure that your item names match the headers in your spreadsheet. The data can consist of text and images (note that images need to be served from a URL).


For best results make sure that you have you prepared your 'template' creatives in a way that work best for your data. Make sure that your text boxes are sized in a way that the new text can fit, such as keeping the box boundaries within the creative space. Automator automatically resizes the text to fit the text box, so keep that in mind when it comes to text that you don't want to be larger than a button or text that goes over an focal point of an image.
plugins.tagline: Automate hundreds of creatives instantly.

plugins.name: Fast make grid
plugins.description:
🎛️ Grid Generator

Grid Generator es una herramienta que diseñé para crear grillas dinámicas y bien estructuradas basadas en frameworks populares como Bootstrap y Foundation. Mi objetivo fue simplificar la configuración de columnas, breakpoints y márgenes para tus diseños, garantizando precisión y ahorrándote tiempo.


Ya sea que estés trabajando en un diseño responsive, configurando un sistema de diseño o ajustando márgenes precisos, Grid Generator te ofrece la flexibilidad que necesitas para que te concentres en lo importante: ¡diseñar! ✨


✅ Soporte para Frameworks Populares

Genera grillas ajustadas a los breakpoints de:

  1. Bootstrap: Desde xs hasta xxl.
  2. Foundation: Desde small hasta xlarge.


✅ Contenedores Dinámicos

Configura contenedores:

  1. Fixed: Se ajusta al ancho del breakpoint seleccionado.
  2. Fluid: Se adapta al ancho completo del frame.


✅ Márgenes Automáticos

Agrega márgenes externos dinámicos en contenedores Fixed, calculados según el framework seleccionado:

  1. Bootstrap: 12px por lado.
  2. Foundation: 16px por lado.


✅ Cálculo Preciso de Columnas

El plugin ajusta el tamaño de las columnas automáticamente según el ancho disponible, restando márgenes y gutters para garantizar una alineación perfecta.


¿Cómo usarlo?

  1. Selecciona un Frame
  2. Asegúrate de tener un frame seleccionado para aplicar la grilla.
  3. Configura la Grilla
  4. Escoge un framework (Bootstrap o Foundation).
  5. Selecciona un breakpoint.
  6. Define el tipo de contenedor (Fixed o Fluid).
  7. Elige el número de columnas (4 o 12).
  8. Haz clic en "Generar Grilla" para aplicar la configuración al frame.


Opcional: Agregar Márgenes

Si el contenedor es Fixed, usa el botón "Agregar Márgenes" para incluir márgenes externos a los extremos.


Si tienes consejos o mejoras me dejas un comentario!!!
plugins.tagline: Crea grillas rapidamente en un frame para tus diseños responsivos

114023.name: Fast make grid
114023.description:
🎛️ Grid Generator

Grid Generator es una herramienta que diseñé para crear grillas dinámicas y bien estructuradas basadas en frameworks populares como Bootstrap y Foundation. Mi objetivo fue simplificar la configuración de columnas, breakpoints y márgenes para tus diseños, garantizando precisión y ahorrándote tiempo.


Ya sea que estés trabajando en un diseño responsive, configurando un sistema de diseño o ajustando márgenes precisos, Grid Generator te ofrece la flexibilidad que necesitas para que te concentres en lo importante: ¡diseñar! ✨


✅ Soporte para Frameworks Populares

Genera grillas ajustadas a los breakpoints de:

  1. Bootstrap: Desde xs hasta xxl.
  2. Foundation: Desde small hasta xlarge.


✅ Contenedores Dinámicos

Configura contenedores:

  1. Fixed: Se ajusta al ancho del breakpoint seleccionado.
  2. Fluid: Se adapta al ancho completo del frame.


✅ Márgenes Automáticos

Agrega márgenes externos dinámicos en contenedores Fixed, calculados según el framework seleccionado:

  1. Bootstrap: 12px por lado.
  2. Foundation: 16px por lado.


✅ Cálculo Preciso de Columnas

El plugin ajusta el tamaño de las columnas automáticamente según el ancho disponible, restando márgenes y gutters para garantizar una alineación perfecta.


¿Cómo usarlo?

  1. Selecciona un Frame
  2. Asegúrate de tener un frame seleccionado para aplicar la grilla.
  3. Configura la Grilla
  4. Escoge un framework (Bootstrap o Foundation).
  5. Selecciona un breakpoint.
  6. Define el tipo de contenedor (Fixed o Fluid).
  7. Elige el número de columnas (4 o 12).
  8. Haz clic en "Generar Grilla" para aplicar la configuración al frame.


Opcional: Agregar Márgenes

Si el contenedor es Fixed, usa el botón "Agregar Márgenes" para incluir márgenes externos a los extremos.


Si tienes consejos o mejoras me dejas un comentario!!!
114023.tagline: Crea grillas rapidamente en un frame para tus diseños responsivos

plugins.name: Radix Colos as figma variables
plugins.description:
Here is the first version of Radix colors as Figma variables. Beta.


Radix Colors - "A gorgeous, accessible color system for user interfaces"


This plugin is a simple way for you to get any of the Radix colors as variables into a variable collection from any of your files.


The plugin allows you to:

  1. add any color to a preferred variable collection
  2. add solid or alpha variants
  3. choose light or dark values for single mode collections
  4. add both light and dark values as modes for multimode collections (Figma paid seat is required for variable modes)
  5. (soon) add a custom color created in radix web ui
  6. set-up a new variable collection with 2 modes
  7. choose your own collection where to put the variables
  8. choose your ow light and dark modes from the collection


INFO: The plugin is functional, but the user guide and error handling are not done yet. I am releasing it as i is for now so everybody can use the current feature set that covers most of the intended feature set


In order for the plugin to function, you need to go to settings and:

  1. select a mode of operation
  2. select or create a variable collection. It can be renamed at any time in the Figma UI
  3. select variable modes where the values will land. (They can also be renamed at any time)


Settings are saved as you select them.

Known bug: When you create a new collection, you need to close and reopen the settings page to reflect the changes, or press the refresh button.


This was mostly developed in coffee shops. I hope you see where i'm going with this... 😆


https://www.buymeacoffee.com/bogris
plugins.tagline: add Radix colors as Figma variables intou your collection

plugins.name: Tailwind Tokens - Create Tailwind CSS Variables & Styles
plugins.description:
Tailwind Tokens – Create Tailwind CSS with Figma in One Click


Tailwind Tokens is your bridge between Tailwind CSS and Figma’s variables & styles. No more copy-pasting. No more design drift. Just clean, synced Tailwind CSS in seconds.


🎯 What it does

Automatically turns your entire Tailwind token set into native Figma variables and styles.


✨ Key Features

  1. Full Tailwind support – Covers every token category.
  2. One-click generation – Instantly create or update variables and styles.
  3. Selective sync – Only update what you need by category or individual token.
  4. Auto-scoped variables – Tokens are auto-scoped into Figma's variables.
  5. Safe & non-destructive – Updates existing styles without overwriting.
  6. Token management – Rename, reset, delete, or track custom tokens.


🚀 Why it matters

Cut hours of repetitive work. Eliminate errors. Keep code and design in perfect harmony.

Tailwind Tokens brings your system to life. Fast, accurate, effortless.

plugins.name: Base64 Encoder
plugins.description:
A Figma plugin that streamlines the process of using SVGs in web projects by automating the export, optimisation, and conversion to base64-encoded data URIs for both CSS and HTML.


Overview

If you've ever needed to embed SVGs directly in your code, you know the process can be tedious:


  1. Export the SVG from Figma
  2. Optimise it with a tool like SVGO
  3. Convert it to base64
  4. Format it properly for CSS or HTML


This plugin automates the entire workflow with a single click. Select any frame or element in Figma and instantly copy optimised, base64-encoded SVGs ready to use as:


HTML <img> tags

CSS background-image properties

CSS mask-image properties (with customisable colours)


When to Use Base64-Encoded SVGs


Base64-encoded SVGs are particularly useful for:


  1. Email templates where external images may be blocked or filtered
  2. CSS backgrounds and decorative elements when you want to avoid additional HTTP requests
  3. Custom list markers that need to maintain consistency across email clients
  4. Icon systems where you need a small number of icons without the overhead of an icon font
  5. Mask images in CSS when you need a shape with a customisable fill colour
  6. Offline applications or environments with limited connectivity
  7. Performance optimisation for small, frequently used graphics


In these scenarios, embedding SVGs directly in your code eliminates HTTP requests, avoids CORS issues, and ensures visual elements display correctly regardless of external resource availability.
plugins.tagline: Instantly export, optimise, and convert SVGs to base64 for CSS and HTML 🚀
